In the MBC CQRS serverless, DynamoDB tab: In the MBC CQRS serverless, DynamoDB tables are organized into three classes based on their purpose.
`tasks` table: store information about l: `tasks` table: store information about long-running tasks
other tables: can be divided into three: other tables: can be divided into three types: command tables (with a `-command` postfix in name), data tables (with a `-data` postfix in name), and history tables (with `-history` posfix in name). You only need to specify the table name, add the name in `prisma/dynamodbs/cqrs.json`, and the command below will create the table for you.
The table definition is store in `prisma: The table definition is store in `prisma/dynamodbs` folder.
For local development, run `npm run migr: For local development, run `npm run migrate:ddb` to migrate dynamo table.
You can apply migrate both dynamoDB and: You can apply migrate both dynamoDB and RDS with singe command: `npm run migrate`.
For actions base on Dynamodb, please ref: For actions base on Dynamodb, please refer to the [Sequence](./sequence.md) and [CommandModule](./command-module.md) sections.
